abstract: Ma Xingrui, chief of Communist Party in Shenzhen, China, publicly apologizes for collapse of construction debris that has left 33 buildings in ruins and dozens of people trapped; apology comes in wake of finding by central government investigators that disaster was man-made.
lead_paragraph: The city’s Communist Party chief offered an unusual apology for a construction collapse that toppled 33 buildings.

headline.main: Chinese Official Vows Punishment Over Shenzhen Landslide
headline.print_headline: Chinese Official Offers Rare Apology for Shenzhen Disaster

snippet: The city’s Communist Party chief offered an unusual apology for a construction collapse that toppled 33 buildings.
